Introduction to MSI MAG B760M Mortar WiFi Gaming Motherboard

The MSI MAG B760M Mortar WiFi is a robust Micro-ATX gaming motherboard from MSI’s MAG series, built with a military-inspired design for durability and high-performance gaming. It pairs seamlessly with Intel’s 12th, 13th, and 14th Gen Core processors (plus Pentium Gold and Celeron) on the LGA 1700 socket, delivering lightning-fast experiences through advanced power delivery, thermal management, and connectivity. Ideal for gamers seeking stability under heavy loads, it features a 12+1+1 Duet Rail Power System with dual 8-pin connectors, Core Boost technology, and a 6-layer PCB with 2oz thickened copper for reliable signal transmission and overclocking potential.

Key Features

  • Performance and Power: Equipped with Core Boost and digital PWM for precise multi-core CPU power, Load-Line Calibration for voltage stability, and Memory Boost supporting DDR5 up to 7200+ MHz (OC) with XMP profiles. Includes Resizable BAR for optimized GPU performance and a 60-day AIDA64 Extreme trial for monitoring.
  • Storage and Expansion: Dual Lightning Gen4 M.2 slots (up to 64Gbps) with M.2 Shield Frozr cooling, plus 4x SATA 6Gbps ports. Features PCIe 5.0 x16 slot with Steel Armor for bandwidth up to 128GB/s, reducing lag in graphics-intensive games.
  • Connectivity: 2.5Gbps LAN for wired gaming, Wi-Fi 6E with Bluetooth 5.3 for low-latency wireless, and Lightning USB 3.2 Gen2x2 (20Gbps) via rear Type-C and front headers. Supports HDMI/DP outputs and Mystic Light for RGB synchronization.
  • Cooling and Build Quality: FROZR AI Cooling auto-adjusts fans based on CPU/GPU temps, with extended heatsinks, 7W/mK thermal pads, and pump fan support up to 3A. DIY-friendly with EZ M.2 Clip, Flash BIOS Button, pre-installed I/O shield, and EZ Debug LED.
  • Audio and Extras: Audio Boost delivers studio-grade sound with isolated signals and de-pop protection. Mystic Light Extension adds RGB support for peripherals, and it’s Windows 11 compatible.

Main Specifications

| Category | Details | |—————-|———| | Chipset | Intel B760 | | Form Factor| mATX | | Memory | 4x DDR5 slots, up to 192GB, 7200+ MHz (OC) | | Expansion | 1x PCIe 5.0 x16, 2x PCIe 3.0 x1 | | Storage | 2x M.2 (Gen4), 4x SATA 6Gb/s | | Networking | 2.5G LAN, Wi-Fi 6E, BT 5.3 | | USB | Rear: 1x USB 3.2 Gen2x2 Type-C, 1x Gen2 Type-A, 2x Gen1 Type-A, 4x USB 2.0; Front: USB 3.2 Gen1, Gen2 Type-C | | Audio | Realtek ALC1200, 7.1-channel | | Power | 12+1+1 phases (90A SPS) |

This motherboard excels in balancing affordability with premium gaming features, making it a solid choice for mid-range builds focused on speed, connectivity, and future-proofing.
